feed.title: NewsTracker: state islamic
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Islamic State claims role in suicide bombings at Yemen mosques that kill more than 130
entry.summary:
If the claim is true - and the U.S. expressed skepticism - Friday's attacks would be the first by the Islamic State group in Yemen, adding a frightening new layer to the country's turmoil.

If Friday's bombings were carried out by Islamic State group supporters, it could be intended as a dramatic signal to al-Qaida, the group's rival - effectively a challenge over turf.

entry.title: U.S. fears Islamic State is making serious inroads in Libya
entry.summary:
The officials said what they called "senior" Islamic State leaders had traveled to the country, which is whacked by civil war, to help recruit and organize militants, particularly in the cities of Derna and Sirte.

The State Department document said estimates of the number of Islamic State fighters operating in Libya ranged from 1000 to 3000.

U.S. officials said that because of its strategic position, Libya had become a springboard for would-be fighters from across North Africa wanting to link up with the Islamic State.

U.S. officials said Libya Dawn, an Islamist, but non-Jihadist, movement based in the city of Misurata, was mounting a counter-attack against Islamic State forces, a development which the United States considered encouraging.

Islamic State has also endorsed, or received expressions of loyalty, from other militants around the region, including factions based in Nigeria, Yemen, Afghanistan, Pakistan and Egypt's Sinai Peninsula.

U.S. agencies are evaluating evidence that appears to tie Islamic State to the militants who killed 20 foreign tourists on Wednesday at a museum in Tunis, the capital of Libya's western neighbor Tunisia.

entry.title: Yemen's Islamic State affiliate claims mosque attacks that killed 137
entry.summary: In its claim of responsibility, an alleged Islamic State affiliate calling itself "Sanaa Province" warned of an "upcoming flood" of attacks targeting the Houthi rebels.

entry.title: Italy hosts meeting to combat Islamic State group financing
entry.summary: A U.S. Treasury Department statement said key steps include cracking down on unregulated money remitters and countering the Islamic State group's exploitation of cash, oil, cultural property and other resources.

entry.title: Italy hosts meeting to combat Islamic State group financing
White House: No sign of Islamic State link to Yemen attacks
entry.summary: White House spokesman Josh Earnest said the U.S. is still investigating the claim of responsibility by the Yemeni branch of Islamic State.

entry.title: White House: No sign of Islamic State link to Yemen attacks
Yemen?s Islamic State affiliate claims attacks; 137 dead
entry.summary:
A purported affiliate of the Islamic State group claimed responsibility for the bombings, which also wounded 357 people - raising the alarming possibility the extremist group has expanded its presence to Yemen after already setting up a branch in Libya.

The statement was posted on the same web bulletin board where the Islamic State claimed responsibility for Wednesday's deadly attack on a museum in Tunisia.

entry.title: Islamic State claims responsibility for Tunisia attack that killed three Japanese
entry.summary: While militant attacks may not necessarily have been centrally planned, they have succeeded in spreading fear and damaging the economy - and giving the impression of an all-powerful radical Islamic network extending its reach.

entry.title: Islamic State Claims Responsibility for Tunisia Attack
entry.summary:
"I think (the Islamic State) is probably taking credit for something it may not have played a role in," said Geoff Porter, a security analyst for North Africa.

Confronted with a poor economy, young Tunisians have disproportionately gone abroad to fight with extremist groups in Libya, Syria and Iraq, including some affiliated with the Islamic State.

"It could have been people who fought with the Islamic State or were inspired by it," said Raffaello Pantucci, director of International Security Studies at the Royal United Services Institute, a British think tank.

entry.title: Islamic State group claims deadly attack on Tunis museum
entry.summary: In an audio message posted online, IS said "two knights from the Islamic State... heavily armed with automatic weapons and grenades, targeted the Bardo Museum" in the capital.

entry.title: Islamic State claims responsibility for Tunisia attack
entry.summary: In claiming responsibility for the attack, the Islamic State group issued a statement and audio on jihadi websites applauding the dead gunmen as "knights" for their "blessed invasion of one of the dens of infidels and vice in Muslim Tunisia."

entry.title: Islamic State claims deadly Tunisia museum attack
entry.summary:
Islamic State, which has declared a caliphate in large parts of Iraq and Syria and is active in Tunisia's chaotic neighbour Libya, praised the two attackers in an audio recording as "knights of the Islamic State" armed with machineguns and bombs.

"We tell the apostates who sit on the chest of Muslim Tunisia: Wait for the glad tidings of what will harm you, o impure ones, for what you have seen today is the first drop of the rain," the Islamic State audio said in Arabic.

entry.title: Islamic State claims responsibility for Tunisian museum attack
entry.summary:
A former commander in Tunisia's Ansar al Sharia was killed last week fighting for Islamic State in Libyan city of Sirte.

A daily Islamic State news broadcast distributed online also mentioned the Tunis attack, describing the perpetrators as Mujahideen and asking God to receive them as martyrs in paradise.

entry.title: Islamic State find allies among Tunisia militants
entry.summary: Its leader, Seifallah Ben Hassine, fled to Libya where the group appears to have been absorbed by the local chapter of the Islamic State.

entry.title: Tunisia Hospitable to Islamic State Recruiting
entry.summary: Rather than being overt Islamic State members, it is likely that perpetrators of Wednesday's attack came from the large mass of disaffected young people in the country, some of whom fought with extremists groups in Syria or were inspired by their radical rhetoric.

entry.title: Islamic State claims responsibility for Tunisia
entry.summary: Islamic State claims responsibility for Tunisia The Islamic State group has issued a statement claiming responsibility for the deadly attack on Tunisia's national museum that killed 23 people, mostly tourists.

entry.title: Islamic State group claims responsibility for Tunisia museum attack
entry.summary: Tunisia has faced scattered extremist violence, and a disproportionately large number of Tunisians have joined Islamic State fighters in Syria and Iraq.

entry.title: ICC should prosecute Islamic State for Iraq genocide, war crimes: U.N.
entry.summary:
GENEVA (Reuters) - The United Nations said on Thursday Islamic State forces may have committed genocide in trying to wipe out the Yazidi minority in Iraq as well as war crimes against civilians including children.

She added that mass graves were being uncovered in areas recently retaken by Iraqi government forces from Islamic State.

U.N. investigators also cited allegations that Islamic State had used chlorine gas, a prohibited chemical weapon, against Iraqi soldiers in the western province of Anbar in September.

Islamic State has treated captured women and children as "spoils of war", often subjecting them to rape or sexual slavery, the report added.

entry.title: International Criminal Court should prosecute Islamic State for Iraq genocide, war crimes: UN
entry.summary:
The UN Human Rights Council launched its inquiry in September after the Islamist militant group Islamic State, also known as ISIS or ISIL, seized large swathes of northern Iraq.

There was a "manifest pattern of attacks" by Islamic State on Yazidis as well as Christians and other minorities as it laid siege to towns and villages in Iraq.

entry.title: ICC should prosecute Islamic State for Iraq genocide, war crimes: U.N.
entry.summary: It said the insurgents' Islamic sharia courts in Mosul had meted out cruel punishments including stoning and amputation.

entry.title: ICC should prosecute Islamic State for Iraq genocide, war crimes: U.N.
U.S. veteran pleads not guilty to trying to help Islamic State
entry.summary: U.S. federal agents found recent Internet searches on Pugh's laptop and other devices for "borders controlled by Islamic State" and a propaganda video by the group, according to prosecutors.

entry.title: Canada to extend, expand its mission against Islamic State: PM
entry.summary: Canada has around 70 special forces operating in northern Iraq and has also provided six jets to take part in U.S.-led bombing missions against Islamic State.

entry.title: Harper says his government will ask for ?extension and expansion? of mission against Islamic State
US says it struck Islamic State drone in Iraq
entry.summary: A spokesman for the U.S. military command in charge of the conflict against the Islamic State said Wednesday that the drone was a small, unarmed hand-held type of the sort that can be purchased commercially.

entry.title: EU's Mogherini blames Islamic State for Tunisia attack
Iraq Sunni Province Key to Taking Mosul From Islamic State
entry.summary: Anbar, west of Baghdad, was the first province to fall under Islamic State's control during the group's blitz last year.

entry.title: Iraq Sunni province key to taking Mosul from Islamic State
entry.summary:
BAGHDAD (AP) - Iraq's Sunni province of Anbar is key to launching the long-awaited operation to retake the city of Mosul from the Islamic State group, the country's defense minister said Wednesday.

At the moment, Iranian-backed Iraqi soldiers and allied Shiite militias are fighting to retake Islamic State-held city of Tikrit, Saddam Hussein's hometown - an offensive that is taking place without U.S. airstrikes.

"Iraqis are caught between the horrors ISIS commits and abusive behavior by militias, and ordinary Iraqis are paying the price," Stork added, using an alternative acronym for the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Libyan official: Clash with Islamic State militant kills 10 troops loyal to Tripoli government
entry.summary: The power struggle and fierce fighting has plunged the country into chaos and paved the way for the Islamic State group's expansion.

entry.title: Feds: US Air Force Vet Tried to Join Islamic State Group
U.S. Air Force veteran accused of trying to assist Islamic State
Feds: US Air Force vet tried to join Islamic State group
entry.summary:
"I will use the talents and skills given to me by Allah to establish and defend the Islamic States. There is only two possible outcomes for me. Victory or martyr," Pugh wrote in a letter last month that investigators said they found on his laptop.

They also found about 180 extremist propaganda videos, including Islamic State group footage of prisoners being executed, according to a court complaint.

The Department of Justice has charged roughly 20 people in the past year with planning to travel to the Middle East to fight alongside militants like the Islamic State group, which controls parts of Syria and Iraq.

entry.title: U.S. Air Force vet charged in plot to aid Islamic State group
entry.summary: Prosecutors said Pugh then decided to join the Islamic State group, traveling from Egypt to Turkey to ultimately cross the border into Syria.

entry.title: Islamic State group reports Tunisian leader killed in Libya
entry.summary: Ben Hassine and Al-Rouissi fled to Libya where they began fighting under the banner of the Islamic State group, which already controls about a third of Syria and Iraq in a self-declared caliphate.

entry.title: Islamic State group reports Tunisian leader killed in Libya
entry.summary: The Islamic State group posted a eulogy on a militant website for Ahmed al-Rouissi after he was killed in clashes around the Libyan city of Sirte - a stronghold for the Islamic State affiliate.

entry.title: UN envoy in Afghanistan worries ISIS has foothold
entry.summary: The top UN envoy in Afghanistan said Monday that recent reports indicate the Islamic State extremist group has established a foothold in Afghanistan, a view echoed by Russia which urged the Security Council to stop its expansion.

entry.title: Kurds report more chlorine attacks by Islamic State as Iraq pauses Tikrit offensive
entry.summary: Shia Turkmen fighters also clashed for a fourth day with Islamic State insurgents near Bashir village, south of Kirkuk.

entry.title: Islamic State fighters suspected of using chlorine gas in Iraq
entry.summary: The statement from Kurdish authorities about Islamic State's use of chlorine referred to footage of "similar attacks" during the recent fighting around Tikrit, though the mayor and another security official only noted the presence of chlorine found in areas recently seized back from IS.

entry.title: Islamic State militants claim attack on checkpoint in Libya's capital
entry.summary:
TRIPOLI (Reuters) - Militants loyal to Islamic State claimed an attack at a checkpoint in a suburb of the Libyan capital on Sunday, according to a statement on social media, days after a similar attack on a police station.

Islamic State militants published on social media a picture of a security directorate building next to the checkpoint which they said was the location of an explosion.

entry.title: Fighting between militias and Libyan Islamic State branch
entry.summary:
After surrounding the Islamic State-controlled city of Sirte for several weeks, the militias were about 16 kilometers (10 miles) west of the center of the city on Sunday.

The Libyan turmoil has provided fertile ground for militants allied with the Islamic State group, which is fighting in Iraq and Syria to expand its self-styled caliphate.

entry.title: Fighting between militias and Libyan Islamic State branch
entry.summary:
Field commander Mohammed Abdullah said that the fighting started when an Islamic State-affiliated suicide car bomber killed a solider from Battalion 166.

He said that they have information that the Islamic State affiliate has taken over a hotel, the main conference center and a prison inside Sirte.

entry.title: Fighting between militias and Libyan Islamic State branch
Vatican backs force to stop Islamic State
entry.summary: Washington: The Vatican's envoy to the United Nations in Geneva has endorsed military action against the Islamic State group in Iraq and Syria.

entry.title: UK teens suspected of trying to join Islamic State arrested
entry.summary: Security services estimate some 600 Britons have gone to Syria or Iraq to join militant groups, including the man known as "Jihadi John" who has appeared in several Islamic State beheading videos.

entry.title: Iraqi militia loyal to radical cleric joins Tikrit offensive
entry.summary: BAGHDAD: Dozens of fighters with the militia loyal to radical Shia cleric Muqtada al-Sadr left Iraq's capital on Sunday to take part in an offensive to capture Tikrit from the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Three U.K. teens detained in Istanbul trying to join Islamic State
entry.summary: Their arrest comes after three London schoolgirls entered Turkey last month and are thought to have joined Islamic State in Syria.

entry.title: Seven air strikes target Islamic State in Iraq, four in Syria: U.S. military
entry.summary: The air strikes in Syria were focused near Kobani, at the border with Turkey, and destroyed nine Islamic State combat positions and a vehicle, the statement said.

entry.title: Ex-IS hostage describes mock executions while held in Syria
entry.summary: Espinosa said he and the other hostages dubbed three English jihadis who were part of the Islamic Stage group "The Beatles" - even though the world-famous Liverpool band had four members.

entry.title: Iraqi Kurds say Islamic State used chlorine gas against them
Islamic State fighters and force allied with Tripoli clash in central Libya
entry.summary:
Islamic State, which analysts say is splintered into smaller factions in Libya, has sought to exploit turmoil in the major oil producer where two rival governments and their respective allies fight for power.

On Saturday, Islamic State militants clashed with forces allied to a Tripoli-based government that was established after an armed faction called Libya Dawn seized the capital in August.

Residents confirmed the fighting, some 60 km (40 miles) east of Sirte, a major city where Islamic State have taken over government buildings, a university and a radio station.

entry.title: Iraqi Kurds says Islamic State used chlorine gas against them
entry.summary: When he joined Islamic State, it gave the insurgent force a chemical weapons capability, it added.

entry.title: Islamic State used chemical weapons against peshmerga, Kurds say
entry.summary: Those bombers belonged to al-Qaida in Iraq, which later became the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Iraqi Kurds says Islamic State used chlorine gas against them
entry.summary: The Security Council of the semi-autonomous Kurdish region said in a statement to Reuters that the peshmerga had taken soil and clothing samples after an Islamic State car bombing attempt on Jan. 23.

entry.title: IS 'used chlorine gas as weapon'
entry.summary: In October, Iraqi officials claimed Islamic State militants may have used chlorine-filled cylinders during clashes in late September in the towns of Balad and Duluiya.

entry.title: Kurds battle Islamic State in Syria, U.S.-led coalition jets strike
entry.summary:
Last week Islamic State appeared to try to seize back the initiative, attacking Kurdish fighters using tanks and heavy weapons close to the Turkish border.

Backed by Iraqi Kurdish peshmerga fighters and air strikes, the YPG defeated Islamic State in the border town of Kobani in January.

entry.title: Kurds of Syria, Turkey and Iraqi unite to build Kurdistan - an alternative state and direct challenge to Islamic State's caliphate
entry.summary:
As they fight to push the Islamic State back from their lands, they are also dreaming of opening safe passages between their cantons, now separated by hundreds of kilometres and thousands of militants.

Children on a farm recently freed from Islamic State control.

Just over a year later, Jazira, home to 1.5 million people, is holding municipal elections - amid the carnage of Syria's four-year civil war and the mounting horror of Islamic States's march through Syria and Iraq.

Hamid Derik, who is training new conscripts to Rojava's army, sits under a picture of 22-year-old Arin Mirkan, who ran into a group of Islamic State soldiers and blew herself up.

Three young YPG fighters prepare to leap from their lookout near the village of Tel Marouf, freed from the Islamic State two days before.

Young women guard the Asayish (Kurdish intelligence agency) headquarters in Tel Tamer, where Islamic State militants had earlier attacked a string of Assyrian villages along the Khabur River, kidnapping at least 220.

entry.title: Kurdish fighters hold funeral for Australian Ashley Johnston, killed fighting Islamic State
entry.summary: The body of Australian army reservist Ashley Johnston, who was killed on the frontline in Syria fighting with Kurdish forces against Islamic State militants, has been handed over to family representatives in Turkey, Kurdish officials said.

entry.title: Iraqi forces pause in battle to drive Islamic State from Tikrit
entry.summary:
A source in the military command said Iraqi forces would not move forward until reinforcements reached Tikrit, of which Islamic State still holds around half.

A victory in Tikrit would give Iraqi forces momentum for the next stage of the campaign to retake Mosul, the largest city under control of Islamic State.

Islamic State fighters overran the city last June during a lightning offensive that was halted just outside Baghdad.

Islamic State spokesman Abu Mohammad al-Adnani said in an audio-recording published on Thursday that its fighters remained "steadfast" and were growing in strength, dismissing its enemies claims of gains in Tikrit as "fake".

entry.title: Obama meets parents of slain Islamic State hostage in Arizona
3 plead not guilty in NYC to Islamic State group terror plot
entry.summary:
According to court documents, Juraboev first came to the attention of law enforcement in August, when he posted on an Uzbek-language website that propagates the Islamic State ideology.

The two exchanged messages on how to get overseas, and Saidakhmetov and an informant watched videos of Islamic State training camps in Syria, according to court papers.

Prosecutors say Saidakhmetov also threatened an attack in the U.S. if he was unable to join the Islamic State group.

entry.title: An Iraqi offensive to dislodge the Islamic State from Tikrit seems to have stalled
entry.summary: Islamic State is on the back foot in the north, where Shi'ite militia and Kurdish forces known as peshmerga went on the offensive around the oil-rich city of Kirkuk on Friday.

entry.title: ISIS Demand a Harsh Tax to Leave Town
entry.summary:
Fearing the city might simply empty of civilians, or that fleeing residents may join the fight against them, the Islamic State extremists are imposing tough measures to prevent people from leaving their territory.

The Islamic State group, which now controls about a third of Syria and Iraq, first banned all former police and army officers from leaving, for fear they would join the fight against IS-rule.

entry.title: Islamic State group accepts Boko Haram pledge of allegiance
entry.summary: Peter Pham, director of the Africa Center at the Atlantic Council, a think tank in Washington, noted the Islamic State group's quick acceptance of Boko Haram's allegiance and said that the bond highlights a new risk.

entry.title: Islamic State group accepts Boko Haram pledge of allegiance
entry.summary: "The prompt - one might even say 'fast-tracked' - acceptance by the so-called Islamic State of Boko Haram's pledge of allegiance" underscores that both needed the propaganda boost from the affiliation, Pham added.

entry.title: Islamic State introduces new restrictions to prevent Mosul residents from fleeing city
entry.summary: Meanwhile, in Mosul - Iraq's second largest city - many residents feel they have no choice but to endure under Islamic State rule.

entry.title: Islamic State accepts Boko Haram's pledge of allegiance
entry.summary: Islamic State militants have accepted a pledge of allegiance by the Nigerian-grown Boko Haram extremist group, a spokesman for the Islamic State movement said Thursday.

entry.title: Islamic State accepts Boko Haram allegiance
entry.summary: In the audio message, Adnani called on Muslims who could not join Islamic State in Iraq and Syria to enter combat in Africa.

entry.title: Iraqi troops, militia retake strategic town north of Tikrit from Islamic State
entry.summary: A Reuters photographer saw dozens of families, who earlier fled al-Alam to escape Islamic State rule, return to the town, celebrating and slaughtering sheep for the victorious forces.

entry.title: 'Israeli spy' Musallam executed by child, according to Islamic State video
entry.summary:
Video posted online by Islamic State shows a boy killing an Israeli Arab accused by IS as working for Mossad.

The mother and father of Muhammad Musallam, an Israeli Arab held by Islamic State in Syria as an alleged spy, hold pictures of him in their Jerusalem home in February.

An image from a video reportedly released by the Islamic State through Al-Furqan, one of the Jihadist platforms used by the militant organisation on the web, shows a youth identifying himself as 19-year-old Mohammed Said Ismail Musallam from Jerusalem.

"I tell my father and my son: Repent to God. I say to the spies who spy on Islamic State: You will not be successful, they will expose you," Musallam said in the latest video, in Arabic.

entry.title: Islamic State video shows killing of teen accused as Israeli spy
entry.summary: In the video, Musallam said he had joined Islamic State to report to the Israelis on weapons caches, bases and Palestinian recruits.

entry.title: Iraq seizes town on outskirts of Islamic State-held Tikrit
entry.summary: After seizing Alam, Shiite militiamen held assault rifles over their heads, chanting that the Islamic State group was "unable to conquer us."

entry.title: Iraqi troops, militia retake strategic town north of Tikrit from Islamic State
entry.summary: Mosul in the far north is the largest city held by the ultra-radical Islamic State, who now rule a self-declared cross-border caliphate in Sunni regions of Syria and Iraq.

entry.title: AP Interview: Syrian magnate denies buying Islamic State oil
entry.summary:
Haswani denied on Tuesday allegations that he bought oil from the Islamic State group for President Bashar Assad's government.

DAMASCUS, Syria (AP) - A Syrian businessman facing European Union sanctions denied on Tuesday allegations that he bought oil from the Islamic State group for President Bashar Assad's government.

Much of the oil is smuggled out of Islamic State-held territory in northern Syria to neighboring Turkey.

entry.title: Boko Haram is said to have pledged allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary: In the message published on his Twitter account on Saturday, Abubakar Shekau, Boko Haram's leader, announced that he had sworn allegiance to the Islamic State, also known as ISIS.

entry.title: Boko Haram is said to have pledged allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary:
New York: One of the deadliest terrorist organisations in Africa has pledged allegiance to the Islamic State, according to a message posted online.

If confirmed, the pledge would make the group, Boko Haram, which is believed to have as many as 6,000 fighters, the largest extremist group to date to agree to fight under the Islamic State banner, analysts said.

Terrorism experts say that the pledge, or "bayat", is a spiritually binding oath, and it indicates that Boko Haram's leader agrees to be under the authority of the Islamic State group.

But as with such pledges from other groups elsewhere in the world, including in Libya, it remains unclear how much direct control the Islamic State leaders have over their distant proxies.

If confirmed, the agreement with Boko Haram would mirror the steps taken by Islamic State affiliates in Libya, Algeria, Egypt, Afghanistan and beyond.

entry.title: Boko Haram is said to have pledged allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary: Weeks later, the oath was formally accepted by the Islamic State in a statement issued by the group's official spokesman.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram, weakened by multinational attacks, pledges allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria - Nigeria's home-grown Boko Haram group, newly weakened by a multinational force that has dislodged it from a score of northeastern towns, reportedly pledged formal allegiance to the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram pledges allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary:
Boko Haram in August followed the lead of IS in declaring an Islamic caliphate in northeast Nigeria that grew to cover an area the size of Belgium.

But Boko Haram has never been an affiliate of al-Qaida, some analysts surmise because al-Qaida considers the Nigerians' indiscriminate slaughter of Muslim civilians as un-Islamic.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram pledges allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary:
The audio script identified the Caliph as Ibrahim ibn Awad ibn Ibrahim al-Awad al-Qurashi, who is better known as Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the leader of Islamic State and self-proclaimed caliph of the Muslim world.

Islamic State's Baghdadi has already accepted pledges of allegiance from other jihadist groups in the Middle East, Afghanistan, Pakistan and north Africa.

entry.title: Iraq says Islamic State militants raze ancient Hatra city
entry.summary: The antiquities ministry said the lack of tough international response to earlier Islamic State attacks on Iraq's historic sites had encouraged the group to continue its campaign.

entry.title: Islamic State militants raze Iraq's ancient Hatra city: Government
entry.summary:
But a resident told Reuters he heard a powerful explosion at Hatra early on Saturday and said that other people nearby had reported that Islamic State militants had destroyed some buildings there and were bulldozing other parts.

Hatra lies about 110 km south of Mosul, the largest city under Islamic State control.

entry.title: Islamic State militants attack Christian villages in Syria
entry.summary: BEIRUT -- Islamic State militants attacked a string of predominantly Christian villages in northeastern Syria on Saturday, touching off heavy clashes with Kurdish militiamen and their local allies, activists said.

entry.title: Iraqi forces approach Tikrit as Islamic State destroys Nimrud
entry.summary:
IS leaders have sought to justify the cultural destruction by asserting that statues and other artefacts violate Islamic prohibitions on idol worship.

But religious authorities have denounced the destruction as barbaric and anti-Islamic.

entry.title: Islamic State militants bulldoze ancient Nimrud city
entry.summary: Iraq's senior Shi'ite cleric, Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani called on the country's deeply divided religious and ethnic groups to come together to fight Islamic State.

entry.title: The truth about Islamic State: what it is, where it is going, how we can fight it
entry.summary: To focus on IS as Islamic is to allow religion to obscure what the movement's other characteristics reveal about cause and effect in the region.

entry.title: The truth about Islamic State: what it is, where it is going, how we can fight it
entry.summary: "The reality is that IS is Islamic, very Islamic," Wood writes.

entry.title: Islamic State militants bulldoze ancient Assyrian city Nimrud
entry.summary:
Baghdad: Islamic State fighters have looted and bulldozed the ancient Assyrian city of Nimrud, the Iraqi government says, in their latest assault on some of the world's greatest archaeological and cultural treasures.

"Islamic State members came to the Nimrud archaeological city and looted the valuables in it and then they proceeded to level the site to the ground," the source said.

The assault against Nimrud came just a week after the release of a video showing Islamic State forces smashing museum statues and carvings in Mosul, the city they seized along with much of northern Iraq last June.

"Daesh terrorist gangs continue to defy the will of the world and the feelings of humanity," Iraq's tourism and antiquities ministry said, referring to Islamic State by its Arabic acronym.

Islamic State, which rules a self-declared caliphate in parts of Iraq and Syria, promotes a fiercely purist interpretation of Sunni Islam which seeks its inspiration from early Islamic history.

entry.title: Iraq says Islamic State militants 'bulldozed' ancient site
entry.summary: Nimrud is a 13th century B.C. Assyrian archaeological site located on the Tigris River just south of Iraq's second largest city, Mosul, which was captured by the Islamic State group in June.

entry.title: Islamic State militants 'bulldozed' archaeological site: Iraqi ministry
entry.summary:
The city, which was destroyed in 612 B.C., is located on the Tigris River just south of Iraq's second largest city, Mosul, which was captured by the Islamic State group in June.

The Islamic State extremists, who control a third of Iraq and Syria, have attacked other archaeological and religious sites, claiming that they promote apostasy.

Earlier this week, a video emerged on militant websites showing Islamic State militants with sledgehammers destroying ancient artifacts at the Mosul museum, sparking global outrage.

The Islamic State group has imposed a harsh and violent version of Islamic law in the territories it controls and has terrorized religious minorities.

entry.title: Islamic State torches oil field east of Tikrit
entry.summary:
Baghdad: Islamic State militants have set fire to oil wells north-east of the city of Tikrit to obstruct an assault by Shi'ite militia fighters and Iraqi soldiers trying to drive them from the area.

A witness and a military source said Islamic State fighters ignited the fire at the Ajil oil field to shield themselves from attack by Iraqi military helicopters.

Control of oil fields has played an important part in funding Islamic State, even if it lacks the technical expertise to run them at full capacity.

A police source in Salahuddin province, where Tikrit is located, said an eight-vehicle convoy of Islamic State insurgents attacked Iraqi forces at dawn on Thursday in al-Muaibidi, east of al-Alam.

entry.title: Islamic State torches oil field east of Tikrit
entry.summary: An online video published early on Thursday purported to show Islamic State militants in Tikrit and al-Alam, taunting their attackers.

entry.title: Californian facing new charges related to attempt to travel to Syria, join Islamic State
entry.summary: The FBI said Dandach told agents he planned to pledge allegiance and offer to help the Islamic State in Syria any way he could.

entry.title: Californian tried to join Islamic State in Syria: prosecutors
entry.summary: Dandach was arrested in July when he tried to travel to Turkey with what the department said was the intent of crossing into Syria to join Islamic State militants.

entry.title: California man sought to travel to Syria to join Islamic State: prosecutors
German man arrested at Duesseldorf airport on suspicion of membership in Islamic State group
Suspected German member of Islamic State group arrested
entry.summary:
He is accused of joining the Islamic State group after traveling to Syria via Turkey in 2013, and then training and fighting with the group before returning to Germany early last year.

Authorities estimate that about 600 Islamic extremists have left Germany to fight in Syria or Iraq in recent years, along with many more from other European countries.

entry.title: Libyan official: Islamic State militants attack oil field
entry.summary:
That's worsened militia violence and allowed militants allied with the Islamic State group to gain control of Sirte and Libya's eastern city of Darna.

These Islamic State-affiliated militants carried out a deadly attack on a luxury hotel in Tripoli in January, and in February released a video showing them behead 21 Egyptian Christians.

The clashes at al-Dhahra are among the first known instances of Libya's Islamist-allied militias battling the Islamic State affiliate.

entry.title: Libyan Official: Islamic State Militants Attack Oil Field
British citizen killed in Syria fighting alongside Kurds against Islamic State group
entry.summary:
Dozens of foreign fighters have traveled to Syria and neighboring Iraq to fight with Kurdish militias battling the Islamic State group.

The Islamic State group, which currently holds territory in a third of Iraq and Syria, has recruited thousands of foreign fighters, mainly from Europe and elsewhere in the Middle East.

Neither the U.S. nor the U.K. have banned citizens from fighting with militias against the Islamic State group, though both consider the Turkey-based Kurdistan Workers' Party, known as the PKK, a terrorist organization.

Australia was also one of the first countries to criminalize travel to Syria's al-Raqqa province, where the Islamic State group has established the de facto capital of its self-styled caliphate.

entry.title: Another Westerner killed by Islamic State days after Australian Ashley Johnston slain in Syria
Islamic State plot suspect to be transferred to NY
entry.summary: Both Saidakhmetov and Juraboev threatened attacks in the U.S. and planned to travel to Syria to join the Islamic State group.

entry.title: AP ANALYSIS: US on sidelines of key Iraqi battle against IS
entry.summary:
Concerns are also mounting over the Shiite militias' battlefield conduct in a largely Sunni region where some residents are said to have initially welcomed the Islamic State militants as a better alternative to the Shiite-led government in Baghdad.

Winning over the Sunni tribes is essential because they know the terrain of the Sunni-majority areas under Islamic State control and can fight with and advise the Shiite fighters.

entry.title: AP ANALYSIS: US on sidelines of key Iraqi battle against IS
entry.summary:
Glaringly absent are the U.S.-led coalition forces whose air campaign since last summer has nearly halted the Islamic State rampage across Iraq.

However, more of a concern for the U.S.-led coalition is Iran's prominent role in the fight against the Islamic State militants.

entry.title: Snipers and booby traps slow Iraq forces from retaking Tikrit from Islamic State
entry.summary:
Baghdad: Iraqi forces have closed in on Tikrit, their progress slowed by jihadist snipers and booby traps, on the second day of Baghdad's largest operation yet against the Islamic State group.

Smoke rises from an explosion as Iraqi forces, Shiite militiamen and Sunni tribal fighters battle Islamic State.

entry.title: General: 8,500 Islamic State fighters killed in Iraq so far
entry.summary:
"If they perform in a credible way" and rid Tikrit of Islamic State control, "then it will, in the main, have been a positive thing in terms of the counter-ISIL campaign," Dempsey said.

Austin made the remarks in his prepared statement at a hearing on President Barack Obama's request for new legal authority to execute the military campaign against the Islamic State.

entry.title: General: 8,500 Islamic State fighters killed in Iraq so far
entry.summary:
Austin, the commander of U.S. Central Command, said the Islamic State, which has controlled key parts of northern and western Iraq since last summer, is no longer capable of seizing and holding new territory.

Earlier on Tuesday, the U.S. general overseeing the military coalition fighting in Iraq told a House panel that the campaign has killed more than 8,500 Islamic State fighters since its bombing campaign began in August.

Austin said that in addition to killing at least 8,500 Islamic State fighters, the U.S.-led bombing has destroyed "hundreds" of the group's vehicles, tanks and heavy weapons.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing Islamic State
entry.summary: Abuja: Nigeria's Islamist sect Boko Haram released a video purporting to show it beheading two men, its first online posting using advanced graphics and editing techniques reminiscent of footage from Islamic State.

entry.title: Status hearing set in Chicago for man accused of seeking to join Islamic State group
Iraqi forces launch major assault to seal off Islamic State around Tikrit
entry.summary:
Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani, who has helped coordinate Baghdad's counter-attacks against Islamic State since it seized much of northern Iraq in June, was overseeing at least part of the operation, witnesses told Reuters.

In contrast the U.S.-led air coalition which has been attacking Islamic State across Iraq and Syria has not yet played a role in Tikrit, the Pentagon said on Monday, perhaps in part because of the high-level Iranian presence.

entry.title: Iraqi forces try to seal off Islamic State around Tikrit
entry.summary: But months of U.S.-led airstrikes, backed up by the Shiite militias, Kurdish peshmerga fighters and Iraqi soldiers, have contained Islamic State in Iraq and pushed it back from around Baghdad, the Kurdish north, and the eastern province of Diyala.

entry.title: Iraqi forces try to seal off Islamic State around Tikrit
entry.summary: The offensive is the biggest in the Salahuddin region north of Baghdad since last summer, when Islamic State killed hundreds of Iraqi army soldiers who had abandoned their base at Camp Speicher outside Tikrit.

entry.title: Nigeria?s Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing Islamic State
entry.summary: Nigeria's President Goodluck Jonathan has said Boko Haram is allied to both al Qaeda and its offshoot Islamic State, though that has not been confirmed by the group itself.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing Islamic State
entry.summary: The Boko Haram film's use of graphics, the footage of black-clad militants with a black flag, and the editing to show only the aftermath of the beheading, were similar to material from Islamic State.

entry.title: Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey threatened by Islamic State
entry.summary:
The Islamic State has declared a new target in its war on the West -- a co-founder of Twitter.

Twitter has routinely shut down Islamic State social media accounts, particularly those that threaten or link to beheadings and other atrocities.

The threat was posted in Arabic under a headline "Foundation for the conquest of Jerusalem for the Islamic State," and "Twitter a target for the caliphate."

The Islamic State is fighting to create an extremist state -- or caliphate -- across a wide area of Iraq and Syria.

Twitter and other social media sites have been cracking down on Islamic State accounts since June, when a major offensive resulted in large swaths land falling into the militant group's hands.

entry.title: Donations drying up for Islamic State group but Syria war refugees could be prime for recruiting: U.S. spy chief
entry.summary: The U.S. spy chief expressed concern about Islamic State militants recruiting fighters from among the huge numbers of refugees who have fled the conflict in Syria.

entry.title: 'That's my son!': Jihadi John's mother screams watching Islamic State video
entry.summary:
The mother of Mohammed Emwazi knew he was Jihadi John and screamed "that's my son" when he first appeared in an Islamic State video - but it is believed she failed to tip off the authorities.

American journalist James Foley was beheaded by Islamic State militants.

Police officers near the home of Islamic State militant Mohammed Emwazi, popularly known as Jihadi John.

entry.title: Iraq launches operation to retake Tikrit from Islamic State
entry.summary: Islamic State fighters have a strong presence in the city and are expected to put up fierce resistance.

entry.title: Iraq launches operation to retake Tikrit from Islamic State
entry.summary: The U.S.-led coalition launching airstrikes targeting the Islamic State group was not involved in the Tikrit operation, Iraqi officials said.

entry.title: 'The threat exists': Vatican on alert for Islamic State attack, says security chief
entry.summary:
"The threat exists. This is what has emerged from conversations with Italian and foreign colleagues," Domenico Giani told Polizia Moderna, the magazine published by Italian police, when asked if threats from Islamic State militants were credible.

Islamic State militants have made threats against Catholic targets in Rome that have been given much space in Italian media.

Executing Christians ... Members of the Islamic State (IS) jihadist group parade down a street in Libya's coastal city of Sirte.

Francis has several times condemned attacks by Islamic militants.

entry.title: Iraq launches attack to retake Tikrit from Islamic State
entry.summary:
In Salahuddin, Islamic State fighters control several strongholds including Tikrit, hometown of executed former president Saddam Hussein and other Tigris river towns.

Artillery gunners in a military base just north of Tikrit also bombarded Islamic State positions in the city, another Iraqi source said.

Monday's offensive follows several failed attempts to drive the militants out of Tikrit since last June, when Islamic State declared a caliphate in the territories it controls in eastern Syria and northern and western Iraq.

entry.title: How Islamic is Islamic State group? Not very, experts say
entry.summary:
An estimated 20,000 have streamed into the territory in Iraq and Syria where the group has proclaimed what it calls a "caliphate" ruled by its often brutal version of Islamic law.

President Barack Obama has insisted the militants behind a brutal campaign of beheadings, kidnappings and enslavement are "not Islamic" and only use a veneer of Islam for their own ends.

The Islamic State group "appears to have adopted violent ideas first, then searched books of religious interpretation to find a cover for their actions," said Sheikh Hamadah Nassar, a cleric in the ultraconservative Salafi movement.

entry.title: Iraq launches operation to retake Tikrit from Islamic State
entry.summary: Tikrit is one of the largest cities held by Islamic State militants and lies on the road connecting Baghdad to Mosul.

entry.title: Twitter, law enforcement investigate alleged Islamic State threats
entry.summary: Islamic State supporters, in online posts on Sunday, called for attacks against Twitter and its "interests," including death threats, according to the online news media company Buzzfeed as well as the NBC news network.

entry.title: Iraq launches operation to retake Tikrit from Islamic State
entry.summary:
Tikrit, the provincial capital of Salauhddin province, 80 miles (130 kilometers) north of Baghdad, fell to the Islamic State group last summer, along with Mosul and other areas in the country's Sunni heartland.

Past attempts to retake Tikrit have failed, as Iraq struggles with its armed forces, which collapsed in the wake of the Islamic State group's offensive last summer.

Ahead of the operation, Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi, a Shiite, called on Sunni tribal fighters to abandon the Islamic State extremist group, offering what he described as "the last chance" and promising them a pardon.

His comments appeared to be targeting former members of Iraq's outlawed Baath party, loyalists to Saddam, who joined the Islamic State group during its offensive, as well as other Sunnis who were dissatisfied with Baghdad's Shiite-led government.

entry.title: How Islamic is Islamic State group? Not very, experts say
entry.summary:
But the Islamic State goes "further than any other scholars have done. They represent the extreme," he said.

It would be a mistake to conclude the Islamic State group's extremism is the "true Islam" that emerges from the Quran and Hadith, he added.

Despite its claim to the contrary, the Islamic State group is largely political, borne out of the conflicts in Syria and Iraq, said Khaled Abou El Fadl, an Islamic law scholar at the University of California, Los Angeles.

Ahmed al-Dawoody, an assistant professor at the Institute for Islamic World Studies at Zayed University in Dubai, agreed.

entry.title: Islamic State group frees 19 Syrian Christians after ransom is paid: activists
entry.summary:
Last week, Islamic State kidnapped 220 Assyrians in the Tal Tamr area where the extremist Islamist group has seized control of 10 Christian villages, said the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights.

The Assyrians, from one of the world's oldest Christian communities, have faced an increasing threat since Islamic State captured large parts of Syria.

entry.title: News24.com | Islamic State releases 19 Christians
entry.summary: More than 200 Assyrians remain in Islamic State hands, said the British-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights.

entry.title: The Islamic State threatens to come to Rome; Italians respond with travel advice
entry.summary:
In a recently released video that showed the killing of 21 Christians in Libya, all but one of them Egyptian, the Islamic State issued an ominous warning: "Today we are south of Rome," one masked militant said.

To make matters worse, Rita Katz, director of SITE Intelligence Group, pointed out that supporters of the Islamic State have begun using a hashtag to warn of their plan to reach "Rome."

Exactly what "Rome" means to the Islamic State is unclear -- some experts say it may actually be a reference to the United States or Turkey, or even the West in general.

As word of #We_Are_Coming_O_Rome spread across the Italian media, Rome residents took the opportunity to respondto the Islamic State.

By this point, the Italian responses to the hashtag far outweigh any from Islamic State supporters, and some Italian publications are beginning to wonder how notable the hashtag was to begin with.

entry.title: Islamic State militants claim suicide attacks in Libya that kill 40
entry.summary:
Cairo: Militants pledging allegiance to the Islamic State have claimed responsibility for three car bombs that killed at least 42 people in a town in eastern Libya in the latest escalation in a surge of violence linked to the group.

Twenty-one Egyptian Christians in orange jumpsuits appear in an Islamic State video being marched by IS militants along a beach, said to be near Tripoli, before each captive is beheaded.

entry.title: Islamic State militants claim suicide attacks in Libya that kill 40
Libya suicide bombs kill 45; Islamic State claims responsibility
entry.summary:
The group said the attacks were in retaliation for the killing of Muslims in the Islamic militant stronghold of Darna.

Egyptian warplanes conducted multiple airstrikes in Darna after militants linked to the Islamic State group beheaded 21 Egyptian Christian hostages.

The attack also targeted the forces of army Gen. Khalifa Hifter -- who has been leading an offensive against Islamic militias on behalf of the internationally recognized government.

entry.title: Fears for Syria-bound London schoolgirls suspected of trying to join Islamic State
entry.summary: London: Three schoolgirls have fled the UK in a suspected bid to travel to Syria and join the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Islamic State claims responsibility for Libya bombings
U.S. announces massive attack plans for 25,000 Iraqi soldier to retake Mosul from ISIS in spring offensive
entry.summary:
But they would be supplemented by three smaller brigades serving as reserve forces, along with three Peshmerga brigades who would contain the Islamic State fighters from the north and west.

At this point, officials estimate there are between 1,000 to 2,000 Islamic State insurgents in the city of Mosul.

entry.title: How strong is the Islamic State in Libya?
entry.summary: The images are clearly aimed as a show of force - an announcement that the Islamic State is now a power in Libya.

entry.title: Pro-Islamic State militants seize Libyan university, say residents
entry.summary: Cairo: Militants claiming loyalty to Islamic State have seized the university in the central Libyan city of Sirte, residents said.

entry.title: Islamic State militants showing some signs of strain
entry.summary: But it was in the Syrian town of Kobani that the Islamic State suffered its worst single loss -- more than 1,000 militants killed -- and much of its heavy weaponry and vehicles destroyed.

entry.title: Some signs of tension emerge among Islamic State militants
entry.summary:
The Islamic State group may be sprouting tentacles across the region but it is struggling in Syria, part of its heartland, where it has stalled or even lost ground in fighting with multiple enemies on multiple fronts.

FILE - This undated file photo posted on Monday, Nov. 4, 2014 by the Raqqa Media Office of the Islamic State group, a militant extremist group, shows Islamic state group fighters in Kobani, Syria.

BEIRUT (AP) - As the Islamic State group tries to expand and take root across the Middle East, it is struggling in Syria - part of its heartland - where it has stalled or even lost ground while fighting multiple enemies on several fronts.

Kurdish forces dealt the Islamic State its heaviest setback by driving it from the border town of Kobani in northern Syria last month.

The gains have strained supply lines between the Islamic State group's westernmost strongholds in Aleppo province from its core territory in eastern Syria.

entry.title: Signs of tensions emerge among Islamic State militants
US-led coalition against Islamic State meets in Saudi Arabia
Iraq civil war leader rallies Shi'ite fighters against Islamic State
entry.summary: A hero to Shi'ite militiamen during Iraq's civil war, he no longer fights but still stirs the hearts of men now battling Islamic State.

entry.title: Islamic State might be harvesting organs, Iraq envoy to U.N. says
entry.summary: Mladenov noted the increasing number of reports and allegations that the Islamic State group is using organ harvesting as a financing method, but he said only that "it's very clear that the tactics ISIL is using expand by the day."

entry.title: Report: Islamic State Militants Burn 45 People To Death In Iraq
Islamic State may be harvesting organs, Iraq envoy to U.N. says
entry.summary: Alhakim briefed the council on the overall situation in Iraq and accused the Islamic State group of "crimes of genocide" in targeting certain ethnic groups.

entry.title: Chicago-area imam charged with sex abuse, faces civil suit
entry.summary:
Mohammad Abdullah Saleem, 75 - who founded the Institute of Islamic Education and is regarded as a leading Islamic scholar, or imam, in the United States - is charged with felony criminal sexual abuse.

The chairman of the Council of Islamic Organizations of Greater Chicago, to which the school does not belong, says he examined the facility's bylaws and found they granted Saleem almost absolute decision-making power.

In light of Saleem's arrest, Mohammed Kaiseruddin said Islamic schools nationwide should rework their bylaws to allow greater oversight.

entry.title: Iraq tells United Nations that Islamic State committed genocide
entry.summary:
UN Assistant Secretary-General for human rights Ivan Simonovic said in October that the campaign of Islamic State militants against Iraq's Yazidi minority may be attempted genocide.

"Equally worrying is the increasing number of reports of revenge attacks committed particularly against members of the Sunni community in areas liberated from (Islamic State) control," he said.

entry.title: Chicago-area imam charged with sex abuse at Islamic school
Man arrested for making bomb threat at Islamic centre in Texas
Iraq tells United Nations that Islamic State committed genocide
entry.summary:
The country's Shi'ite-led government, backed by U.S.-led air strikes, has been trying to push back Islamic State since it swept through mainly Sunni Muslim provinces of northern Iraq in June.

Alhakim said Iraq needed more help to liberate all areas under Islamic State control.

U.N. envoy to Iraq, Nikolay Mladenov, said he was gravely concerned about the safety of Iraq's diverse ethnic and religious communities in areas under Islamic State control, particularly thousands of women and children still in captivity.

entry.title: Man arrested for making bomb threat at Islamic center in Texas capital
entry.summary: On Monday in Houston, a homeless man was arrested and charged with setting a fire that destroyed a building at an Islamic institute in the city last week.

entry.title: Homeless Man Charged in Islamic Center Fire
Egypt strikes Islamic State in Libya, pushes for international action
entry.summary: Egypt now faces threats on two fronts - a growing stronghold of radicals on its western border and a militant insurgency of Islamic State allies on its eastern flank in the Sinai Peninsula - as well as its own internal challenges.

entry.title: Egypt conducts second wave of strikes against Islamic State in Libya in retaliation for mass beheading of Christians
entry.summary:
This video image from aerial footage released by the Egyptian Defence Ministry shows an air strike on a Islamic State position in Libya.

The Coptic labourers were kidnapped by Islamic State militants in Sirt, on Libya's coast, in two attacks in December and January.

Striking back ... Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi continues to target Islamic State jihadists in Libya after they beheaded 21 Egyptian Coptic Christians.

Grief ... A man is comforted as he mourns the Egyptian Coptic Christians who were captured in Libya and beheaded by Islamic State jihadists, outside of the Virgin Mary church in the village of el-Aour, Egypt.

Describing the Islamic State as just "350 kilometres from our shore," Defence Minister Roberta Pinotti told the newspaper Il Messaggero that Italy was ready to send more than 5000 soldiers under a United Nations mandate to stop IS.

entry.title: A history of the Islamic State group's atrocities, gains
entry.summary:
Though beaten back by airstrikes launched by a U.S.-led coalition, the Islamic State group remains a potent threat, Western officials warn.

Early February 2014 - Al-Qaida breaks with al-Baghdadi's group, now known as the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant.

2 - The Islamic State group releases a video showing a jihadi behead American-Israeli journalist Steven Sotloff.

13 - The Islamic State group releases a video showing a jihadi behead British aid worker David Haines.

Oct. 3 - The Islamic State group releases a video showing a jihadi behead British hostage Alan Henning.

Feb. 15 - Libyan militants who earlier pledged their loyalty to the Islamic State group behead a group of Coptic Christians from Egypt in an online video.

entry.title: A look at the Islamic State group's reach into North Africa
entry.summary: Fighting between government forces and Islamic militias rages in the second largest city of Benghazi.

entry.title: "Timbuktu," an Oscar nominee, explores Islamic extremism
entry.summary: A slain assailant suspected in Copenhagen attacks that killed two people this weekend may have been inspired by Islamic militants, Danish authorities said.

entry.title: Egypt strikes back at Islamic State militants after beheading video, killing dozens
entry.summary:
CAIRO: Egypt said it bombed Islamic State targets inside Libya, a day after the group released a video appearing to show the beheading of 21 Egyptians there.

Men purported to be Egyptian Christians held captive by the Islamic State are marched by armed men in this still image from the video.

Egypt's military said the dawn strike hit Islamic State camps, training sites and weapons storage areas.

The 21 Egyptian Coptic Christians, who had gone to Libya in search of jobs, were marched to a beach, forced to kneel and then beheaded, according to the video, broadcast via a website that supports Islamic State.

Security officials say militants based in Libya have established ties with Sinai Province, a group operating from Egypt's Sinai Peninsula that has pledged allegiance to Islamic State.

entry.title: A look at the Islamic State group's reach into North Africa
Pope denounces slaying of Egyptian Copts by Islamic State
Egypt strikes Islamic State group in Libya after video of mass killing
Melbourne man to fight against Islamic State
Egypt strikes IS group in Libya after video of mass beheading surfaces
entry.summary:
Libya's air force, meanwhile, announced it had launched strikes in the eastern city of Darna, which was taken over by an Islamic State affiliate in 2014.

The video purporting to show the mass beheading of Coptic Christian hostages was released late on Sunday by militants in Libya affiliated with the Islamic State group.

Libya in recent months has seen the worst unrest since the 2011 uprising that toppled and killed longtime dictator Moammar Gadhafi, which will complicate any efforts to combat the country's many Islamic extremist groups.

entry.title: Egypt strikes IS group in Libya after video of mass killing
entry.summary: Islamic State group weapons caches and training camps were targeted "to avenge the bloodshed and to seek retribution from the killers," a military statement said.

entry.title: Islamic State: Egyptian president condemns murder of Christians
entry.summary: The makers of the video identify themselves as the Tripoli Province of the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Islamic State battle: Westerners joining Iraqi Christian militia
entry.summary:
Duhok, Iraq: Saint Michael, the archangel of battle, is tattooed across the back of a US army veteran who recently returned to Iraq and joined a Christian militia fighting Islamic State in what he sees as a biblical war between good and evil.

Brett, a Westerner who has joined the Iraqi Christian militia Dwekh Nawsha to fight against Islamic State militants, in Dohuk.

The majority are now under control of Islamic State, which overran Mosul last summer and issued an ultimatum to Christians: pay a tax, convert to Islam, or die by the sword.

entry.title: Westerners Join Iraqi Christian Militia to Fight Islamic State
Sisi warns of response after Islamic State kills 21 Egyptians in Libya
entry.summary:
Egypt's state news agency MENA quoted the spokesman for the Coptic Church as confirming that 21 Egyptian Christians believed to be held by Islamic State were dead.

Al Azhar, the center of Islamic learning in Egypt, said no religion would accept such "barbaric" acts.

Egypt, the most populous Arab state, has not taken part directly in the U.S.-led air strikes against Islamic State targets in Iraq and Syria, focusing instead on the increasingly complex insurgency within its own borders.

entry.title: Islamic State video shows beheadings of 21 Egyptian Christians
entry.summary:
Cairo: A video released by the Islamic State appeared to show the mass beheading of a group of Egyptian Christians by fighters in a recently formed Libyan arm of the militant group.

Fighters under the banner of the Tripolitania Province of the Islamic State announced last month they were holding about 20 Coptic Christians.

entry.title: Video purports to show Islamic State militants in Libya beheading Christian hostages
Islamic State release video showing beheading of 21 Egyptian Christians

Houston arson investigators probe blaze at Islamic center
entry.summary: No one was injured in the early Friday blaze at the Quba Islamic Institute, fire officials said.

entry.title: US: Islamic State fighters killed by Iraqi forces
entry.summary:
Most of the Islamic State fighters died in the attack, killed either by Iraqi government forces or by detonating their suicide vests, said Navy Rear Adm.

Kirby said an estimated 20-25 Islamic State militants were involved in the attack on al-Asad air base in Iraq's Anbar province.

Kirby said Islamic State fighters had taken control of al-Baghdadi, a town near the al-Asad air base.

entry.title: U.S. says 15 more airstrikes launched against Islamic State
entry.summary: In Iraq, the air strikes near al Asad, Mosul and Sinjar hit five units of Islamic State fighters, three buildings, three fighting positions and other targets, according to the statement.

entry.title: Obama asks Congress for Islamic State war powers
